page.title: 02THE W.H.Y.
page.content: The W.H.Y. is a newspaper which is full of advertisements. W.H.Y. means "what have you". A paper like this was needed by the locals to advertise their unwanted goods and their needs. There is also a pets cornerand a whats _ on page. The W.H.Y. started in 1973 and has been running successfully ever since. The paper prints one hundred and fifteen thousand copies a week and they go as far as Solihull, Warwick and Leamington and Stratford. They are delived by boys and girls on a Sunday.They are free papers. But if you buy them on a Saturday they cost ten pence.
